review: It would be quite odd if I say that we went to Portland on a long weekend, like a holiday and we ate at Red Robin .. no offence meant to them .. I mean not many people would want to eat at a restaurant chain that too fast food when one of the major part of their holidays is to explore local food joints :( But then, let's say in short, this was the only option left. Yet the good part was I did not ever have a burger from Red Robin .. so I got that goin' for me, which was nice :D Made two mistakes in our order Saw the menu and then the calories that came along with a burger, all of a sudden I started to search for something which would suit my body and not what I had in my mind .. this was the first mistake :D Though the grilled chicken burger was not bad at all .. but I was hoping to have something fried and crunchy and juicy between the buns ..  But what can we say .. my mistake .. not on 'em. The second mistake however was to order the BOCA patty (vegetarian person not vegan .. should have taken the garden burger) .. and I am sorry but our first ever experience with the BOCA patty wasnt a good one, somehow tasted like cardboard :( .. The good part were the sweet potato fries that we asked as sides. The service was good, the boy who was serving us was extremely livid and cheerful and given the restaurant was to be closed as soon as we were walking out, his energy was really something to be seen. All in all,'an average experience which would make me go to them only when circumstances like these come up again .. I mean when there is no other option.

Ok so I gave this location a second shot and I can see they have upped the game a little bit. Being that it's so close to the airport it's always packed, so that aside the burgers are average the fact that they throw in a new one on the menu every now and again makes me interested enough to come back, definitely not my favorite burger joint but the endless fries or in my case salad is the selling point. If I want to take my family out for Burgers this is where we go.  My burger was actually cooked perfectly unlike my previous visits. The bathroom needed some attention and when I mentioned it to the staff it was taken care of. Are waiter was pleasant and made sure to loop by every 10 minutes or so. All in all not a bad experience.

After a long drive back from Salem, all I wanted was a dessert and maybe a drink. I normally don't like to drink and drive with my kid in the car. So having Red Robin across the Hyatt where I'm at, was good.  I was hoping for a pie but there was none (I should've ordered one from the place I had lunch at earlier which looked sooo good). I ended up with a chocolate fudge cake that was topped with ice cream and surrounded by a strawberry puree. I don't like fruit mixed with chocolate but ordered it anyway. It was ok. Super fudgy so luckily my kid ate most of it. I also ordered the sangria. It wasn't super sweet which I like, but it also lacked any booze. Boo hoo. That was the whole point of me ordering a drink - to relax after that long drive. We ordered a side of fries which I cannot resist as they have the Best fries in my book. Yum. Lesson learned: order only fries!

Came here for my birthday to enjoy a night with my hubby and had the worst I mean the worst service ever the server had a " I DON'T GIVE A F" attitude and the manager that was on duty Matt had that fake cheerleader face like I'm going to pretend I care but I could give a care. I WILL NEVER COME HERE TO THIS RED ROBIN AGAIN!!! Y'all don't even deserve a star  I was NOT even trying to give you NO stars!!!

Hostess ( Christian) was very pleasant and escorted me to open table with menu. Service was fast and food came out pretty quick. Just a chicken sandwich and fries. I did ask back- up server who brought food for barbecue sauce for fries. Said she would be right back. Never returned. Fries were Luke warm to begin with and after 5 minutes the bartender checked on me and I asked her for the sauce. She was very prompt, but by then fries were cold.  Finished meal and just wanted to head back to hotel. Overall good experience, but the devil is in the details. No lemon for water and then no sauce are the little things I judge my quality of service on. Also, this location you park in the back ( shopping center) and have to walk all the way around to front doors located on Main Street, which is a little inconvenient, especially in the rain.

I did a phone order and asked if I could plug in my loyalty number like I have always done. The gentleman named Israel on the phone stated we can't do that here. So, the interaction was not off to a great start. I had an employee go pick up the food as I had ordered it for my staff as a reward meal and they informed me after they ate it that the fries were cold. So disappointing. I will not be using them for any company or personal meals going forward. I just do not get why they are so far from the quality of what their franchise represents with both service and their product. I have gone to many other locations across the West Coast with no issues. Extremely disappointed to say the least.

Our server Jacobk was awesome although it was lunch hour, he kept following up on us to ensure a great lunch experience.  My only disappointment was in my smoke and pepper burger - the bacon was very thin and without taste - like that fake bacon that doesn't need to be refrigerated.  The bbq sauce lacked any originality and the burger would have been better with just mayo and a good mustard.   New pay machines are a hit - no waiting!

I had a gift card, so my boyfriend and I stopped by last night for dinner. It was national pretzel day, so we decided to order the pretzel bites with beer cheese as an appetizer. When they came out, they weren't really that warm and the middles were still frozen. When we brought it up to the waitress (I didn't catch her name), she was extremely polite and immediately took ours back and brought us an entirely new plate. These ones were almost overcooked, really really crunchy, but they still tasted good, and hey, they weren't cold. I got the guac and bacon burger. I don't remember what my boyfriend got, but I think it was something with BBQ sauce on it. My burger was delicious, and I subbed the steak fries for sweet potato fries and those were great too. My boyfriend also enjoyed his food. He says the garlic aioli was phenomenal.  However, when we ordered, we were very clear that I wanted ranch for my fries and he wanted the garlic aioli. When our food arrived, I had some black peppercorn sauce, and he had my ranch. We pointed this out, and once again the server was extremely polite about it, and brought him his aioli and me another ranch, just in case I didn't want to use the one on his plate. Due to the nature of the mistakes, I'm assuming something was going on back in the kitchen, but it was 8:45 on a Thursday night and they weren't super busy at all, so I'm not sure what the problem was. Finally, when we went to pay, there was a $2 entertainment fee that had been charged to our table, buy we hadn't played any games or anything on the tablet. We had to call the server over and have her override the payment so we could actually pay our bill. She said the previous patrons must have played games, put it on a second tab, and then left without paying for it. Overall: the food was tasty and the server was super polite and nice about the few mix up and mistakes that happened. Will be back in the future.

A hint: for lunch, go right when they open at 11.  No line at the door and quick order-taking.  Can't say the same by 11:45, when all tables are occupied and there is a waiting list.  Anyway, the food is standard Red Robin fare, which you might think is good or bad depending on how you feel about burgers.  The nice thing is the all-you-can-eat fries.  Upgrades to sweet potato or garlic fries are possible.  My burger came out perfectly but I order mine well done so it is hard to screw it up (just overcook the patty).  Service was excellent at the beginning and only OK at the end, when the restaurant was full.  Thankfully, there is a machine on the table that you can use to pay by credit or gift card on your own.

Came in just before 5:00  p.m.  Place was empty. Host told us we would have to wait. I pointed out it was empty. He said the servers weren't ready. I told him to let us sit and wait rather than stand in the door. Tried to seat us at the worst booth in an empty restaurant. I made him seat us somewhere nice.  Waitress was pleasant. Brought me a glass of tea packed with ice and 1 ounce of tea (more on that later).  Loved that the menu offered burgers with no bun and alternatives to fries. Ordered a burger, no bun, and beans, no fries. Drank my 1 ounce of tea.  Pushed the server call button on my table to ask for a refill. She never came. When she brought our food I asked if she saw the call light. She said she did, "but I figured you hit it by accident."  I asked for a refill, but no ice. Did she fill my glass? Nope.  She dumped the ice and gave me a glass of warm brewed tea with zero ice.  Sigh.... Burger was cold, on half a bun. Plate had fries and beans. I asked about the fries and was told they forgot so they left them. My guess is they forgot about the bun so just threw out the top.  Sadly, my nephew is a manger for the company.

As I get older, I'm coming to loathe chain restaurants for being mediocre and boring. I've been to this particular location with my in-laws a couple times. I think it's relatively close to their house.  The service was ok, nothing really special or memorable. We always show up in a fairly large group, usually 5 adults and possibly a child.  It always seems really noisy when I'm here. Like, no matter what time it is, it's hard to hear people in my group and really relax and chat with them.  Food is fine. With the burgers, they give you the option of pink or no pink. I think they should order them just like steaks, which most restaurants do, but that's my personal opinion. Word to the wise... avoid the tortilla soup. It's beyond gross. My sister in-law raves about it, but wow! I do like the burger with the fried egg on it, and my husband's favorite seems to be the A.1 burger.  I've learned what is good and what is bad enough to tolerate it when I'm dragged here with the family. Would I return on my own? Hell no. It's a chain restaurant in Portland. There's always way better choices.

I quite often place phone orders or online orders with this location and my order is fulfilled within 15 minutes. I've always been very happy with the in person customer service I receive here as well as the food, which holds the Red Robin standard of being... well... Yummm

Stopped in for a beer and food. Beer selection was not the best. The place was also quite warm. I sat at the bar. Liz was the bartender. She is the reason I stayed. She was very friendly and helpful. She makes drinks, recommends burgers, and even makes shakes. She did it all. I would highly recommend doing something about the temperature but the staff made up for it. I will be back.

Been going here for years but had the worst experience of any Red Robin tonight. It took us about 20 mins to get seated. Normal for 7PM on a Friday night. But then it took an additional 15 before a server got our drink orders. Not to mention an additional 10 minutes to get said drinks. But there's more! How is it that your appetizer comes out after your food? I saw the table next to us got their onion rings after the burger as well. What's even worse is that the gal who brought out my clam chowder dropped the bread and didn't even offer a replacement. I suppose the highlight was that the food quality was decent. The fries are atrocious as they were old. I should also say that you better bring your debit card as paying cash seems to inconvenience the staff here. All in all spent like 1:45 here and most of it, not by choice.

Worst Red Robin's ever. The service here sucks, the food here is even worse. Ordered a burger, medium, and got a super well done dry burger. The fries were so small that getting another bottomless was useless since the service here wasn't very good.

Onion rings were not hot, French fries were not hot. Love the burger, but was not wrapped. Fries were tossed on the plastic plate. Could not be more unappealing. Server had too many tables to give good service. Ordered dessert and took forever to come out. Not worth the calories. Usually I am a huge fan of RR, but this one was not good.

I am sitting here right now. I waited 20 minutes for my partners beverage, which his entree actually showed up before his drink did.  I had to repeat my order three times because the waitress, Leticia, kept talking over me instead of listening and screwing it up.  I ordered a refill on my drink, waited over 10 minutes for it, complained to the service manager and then had it spilled on me. She then disappeared and it was another 10 minutes before I finally got up and asked for my own damn rag to clean up.  I've been here plenty of times and not once have I gotten this sort of service. I will not ever be back.
One of my favorite places to eat because the taste and quality of food is pretty consistent wherever I visit their restaurant.  Love their steak fries seasoned with their brand of season salt too.

Red Robin had a "sale" for "buy one burger or entree and get one for 50% off", so it was a perfect time to go.  We were shopping at Cascade Station and the Red Robin located there was really convenient.  Although it was after 9:00pm, it was still pretty busy. . .with plenty of customers happily chattering away.  I ordered a Sautéed 'Shroom Burger. . .with mushrooms sautéed in garlic and Parmesan and topped with Swiss cheese.  It tasted wonderful, with abundant mushrooms overflowing out.  Also, at Red Robin, you get a choice of having your burger cooked either well-done or "pink on the inside".  It's nice to be able to get a burger that's not just automatically well-done, and mine was perfectly pink, moist and juicy.  My friend ordered an Arctic Cod Sandwich and she enjoyed it very much.  I love that the burgers come with either "Bottomless Steak Fries" OR steamed broccoli.  I got the broccoli (my favorite superfood) and my friend got the fries so we could share and it enabled us to both have a "well balanced" meal.  Our server was very attentive and nice too.  This was an overall very pleasant experience.
Awful service.. slow!.. couldn't get refills like asked.. feel we were ignored! Won't go back to this location.. Garlic butter fries were dry

The night we went it was very busy. There was an NBA game on and a cheer leading team celebrating something. Anywho, we only had to wait 3 mins or so and we got seated in a both. We both order burgers, 35-45 mins later (yes 35-45 mins later) our food was served, COLD. We were starving at that point, so nibbled on some fries, but had to tell our waitress, cause we are not about to pay and eat for a cold meal after waiting that long. She was really nice and apologized and had the kitchen recook our meal, which came out 15 mins later.  I'm just not a fan overall. All that and the burger still tasted so so. I just got a Bacon Cheese Burger with some onion straws on it. Something like a Five Guys would have tasted better and been cheaper in my opinion. Their fries are still pretty delicious, but I'm going elsewhere for my burger cravings. However, they did take off one of our meals as an apology for serving our food cold, which was unexpected and nice. Maybe we'll go back for fries and drinks. :)

Service was slow.  Had to flag her down to refill drinks 45 minutes after our order was taken (Food still didn't arrive for another 15 minutes after that). Our order was only half filled but they put plain fries on it to fill up the plate instead of just letting us know the sweet potato fries would be a moment (or 20.  You know...). The gal was friendly, but that is about all the place had going for them.  Not sure whats up with every restaurant in Cascade Station lately, but the service is slow and muddled, and takes forever to get anything in each of the time over the last few months.   When we finally got all of our food, it was good.  Burger was prepared MR, as I requested.

Had the wedge burger and it was pretty darn good for a "healthy" alternative. I snuck a few fries off my friends plate. They offer an unlimited fries which they probably should for the price. A bit spendy for a burger.

Wife and I went to RR last night (early so no wait) for burgers and fries, she likes sweet potato I get standard ranch cut, both burgers were juicy and tasty, this is our favorite place for this kind of food

Just had lunch with my girlfriend. This was our second time here and we sat at a table in the bar both times. Nothing but perfect service both times. Wanted to write a review this time because our server was training a new server (and I know how much time and effort it takes to show someone the ropes) and our server was flawless. He set a great example for the new teammate and he deserves to be acknowledged for it. Thanks to both of them for a great service experience. Sit in the bar :)
Long wait for order to be taken, service inattentive throughout, missing item from order and, to top it off, we were presented with someone else's check.  wow.  never again.

Why does everyone and their Mom find this place a decent place to eat! It's always the place my out of town friends & family want to go to after I pick them up at PDX.  This location is the worst! I have been here probably no less than 10 times (Not my choice!). Every time I go they are not too busy and every time my food takes 45 minutes or longer to get. Even when all I do is order a salad!  Their excuse always is "we are short staffed." The Management really needs help here. I have returned my food twice for being cold and another time because they gave us someone else's order! And they never refill drinks or ask if everything is alright (probably because they know you will say NO!). I wish I could say I will never go back, but I am sure my time will be wasted again at this joint. Buffalo Wild Wings across the street is just as terrible. I just want my friends & family happy, so Red Robin is just lucky they are a popular chain known everywhere, so they will stay open no matter what kind of shitty food & service they give. ;(

I go here once every two weeks for takeout lunch. It has always been ready on time (I order about 30 mins before I show up). They always get my burger right, I wish they had packets to take their seasoning home but unfortunately they don't. Very nice people, always busy, love this place!

So, I love Red Robin. Their service is neither awful nor awesome, but the food is usually spot on. I am *always* on some sort of ridiculous diet or another and I like that I can always find something to eat here. This particular Red Robin was one of convenience after a torturous shopping trip to Ikea with my baby sister. The food was good, service satisfactory, and ambiance always loud and Red Robin-y.

I would give negative star if I could. I went to this location yesterday for lunch with the family.  Food was as expected and due to the shortage of staff we didn't really get that great of a service.  That's not the issue....... Idiot me, wanting to pay cash so that I can give the waitress cash tip, forgot to put the wallet back into my pocket and just took the change and left. Realizing this after about an hour, I rushed back to the restaurant and looked for the waitress, she immediately recognized me and told me that she found the wallet and took it to the office in the back. I was so excited and was contemplating how much I needed to give her for her heroic act............ About twenty minutes passed when a young manager walked up to me and told me that I needed to give him my contact details as they couldn't find the wallet any more........ WTF? I was shocked....................... To say the least. I actually thought it was joking and told him that I didn't care about the 300 dollars that was in the wallet (210 USD and 90 Canadian dollars as I just came back from Canada) and if he could somehow manage to find my mallet and my credit cards, I would just take it and go.......... Obviously he wasn't joking.... I had him search the office again and he told me nothing turned up...................... Totally unreal and FUxxed UP! GM of this place who supposedly put the wallet on the desk before he left the office told the manager to search all the staffs' purses and bags....... REALLY? Needless to say, my day was spent on canceling my credit cards and bank cards and filling out police report. I know the fault is mine for leaving my wallet there..... And if the waitress told me that she had never seen it... Then I would feel like and idiot and not write this here..... But when the waitress confirmed that she picked it up (actually she told me that she had the bus boy pick it up and bring it to the GM and GM confirmed that he received it from him) and all of a sudden it vanished into the thin air.......  I am so disappointed in the way this management handled this case as they weren't even that apologetic...... Shame on you and what a pathetic customer service mind you have. Red Robin HQ really should consider investigating this location and train their staff.... Especially the GM.  What an idiot and a con artist u are.

Worst service ever food took for ever to receive and got our burgers and no steak knifes to cut our server was  not giving us the attention customers and dirty floors under tables disappointed with this location

Should've trusted the reviews on this one but I was just ordering take out and thought "how bad could that go?" Ordered a chicken Caesar salad and side of fries with a side of ranch. Hung up after placing my order at 4:23pm. They said it would be about 10-15 mins. Picked it up in the bar at 4:41. Not bad.  Got back to my hotel to find my salad has a couple olives and bacon bits in it. Not like they accidentally topped my salad with those things, but like they reused the container or something. Not that they did, it was just weird. Also, there was NO Caesar dressing! They gave me two side of ranch and the salad wasn't tossed and I'm just confused! How hard is it to mess up a three ingredient salad???

What makes this place for me is the bottomless sweet potato fries. I get so excited to come here because sweet potato fries are part of their menu, bottomless-ly. Regular fries and broccoli are also bottomless. They have good combinations for their burgers, but it is a chain place. You know what you are doing. There won't be anything original and ground breaking. Still, better spot than some of the options that surround this place.

Red Robin used to be a great restaurant for their Chicken sandwiches.  Today I had a chicken sandwich that was rubbery and not good.  I appears that this restaurant is cutting food costs and getting cheap/bad product. I will not return to this restaurant and suggest if anyone wants a good chicken sandwich try other restaurants in the area.  If you don't mind fast food, Wendy's down the street has a awesome chicken sandwich of a much better quality a lot better than Red Robin. Hope other people will read this and make their informed decision on where they want to eat.
Teri was our server. 7-28-15, 6:30pm. She was awesome, give her a raise. Great personality, prompt and professional service. Good burgers too.

I went in with my mother in law and my 11 month old daughter, my mother was holding my daughter and The hostess asked us if my daughter and I needed kids menus. I'm 25. And it took us forever to get our waitress to come with the check or to collect the cash. She met me at the door, took the cash and didn't ask if I needed any change.

I visit Red Robin about once a decade. As I recall from my visit in 2004 (not to this location), the burger and fries were halfway decent. NO LONGER. Burger was preformed and likely frozen. Made with ZERO love. We ordered medium-rare in hopes that they'd come with at least a little bit of pink, but as expected, we received well-done. The fries. Bottomless. But what is this? A snack size? I almost wanted to order a refill immediately upon receiving my first allotment. Then I tasted them. Blech. Those six fries were enough. I may actually skip my 2024 visit.

Usually mess up on to-go orders. Food is average here when they get the order correct. They have stepped it up a bit in the bar area where the to-go orders are picked up, but they should try a curbside service since Togo orders are popular here. Also they NEED WIFI they are loosing business to BWW across the street because RR does not offer WIFI!

I don't eat very often at red Robin but when I do I always order the bonzi burger. The bonzi Burger is a very Hawaiian burger with sweet flavor. It's a burger with salads and pineapples on top of it. The burger is huge. Always has such great taste. And all their meals come with free fries. The fries are also unlimited to where you can order as much as you can eat. Normally I order with honey mustard. There honey mustard is the licious compared to other restaurants. Their fries I forgot to mention are one-of-a-kind. There are those along fries that are thick as if you would cut a potato in fifths. I always go out with my friends on Sunday nights to red Robin to relax eat amazing food and enjoy your football game every now and then. The waiters there are very friendly and outgoing.

Chain food... Chain experience... right down to the barely-there wait staff and device they've thrown on the table to order from ("I get a better score if you use the device", says the dude begrudgingly assigned to bring us food). Be aware, they charge you ($1.99) if your kids start poking around on the iPad they put on all the tables to "Order" from. An "entertainment fee", they call it. I told him that they right thing to do would have been to let the parent know that this fee exists. He shrugged his shoulders and chuckled "yeah, kids just push the "pay it" button and play".

I've always loved RR but the last few times have been mediocre at best. Today was another example of their expensive yet still fast food experience. I think we're finally done trying. So over RR and I'm so bummed about it!
GREAT Bloody Marys!!!   Salads are huge....but have to say, their Blue Cheese dressing is disgusting!   Very mayonnaise-y  Service in bar was excellent!
This location advertises business open until midnight and the front doors were locked at 11pm last night.

Red Robin is a good Ole standby. The Hubby and I are in Portland/Vancouver for the weekend to see family. We just stepped out of PDX and was starving. We stopped by this classic for some quick burgers and beers. Consistency is key in a big chain and this location held up well. We sat at the bar and Liz took excellent care of us. She was the perfect amount of attentive. We each got an IPA and I got the Vegan Boca Burger with sweet potato fries. The burger was cooked decent (rare for a commercial veg burger patty). C got the Bleu Ribbon and didn't love it. With steak sauce, Bleu cheese and chipotle aoili it was a bit too much flavor with a bit too little harmonizing. We both left happy though!  I would recommend, especially if you are starving and fresh off the plane.
Food came out cold.  Never got a refill and rarely saw the  waiter. Poorly managed.  Avoid this site if you can.

The waiter came off as creepy, he kept referring to the food as "yummies". If we had small children with us, I'm sure they would have loved him. Despite this, he was incredibly attentive. The bottomless fries were always hot and they kept coming, so we're the sodas. He's only a personality change away from being the best waiter ever.

We stopped at this Red Robin after my brother picked me up at PDX.  We were on the road out to Astoria and needed some dinner.  The parking lot seems small, and it's tough to park a compact car when there are giant SUV's squeezed into the spots.  Also, having a door near the parking lot that makes you weave all through other diners to get to the front desk seems kind of ridiculous- but we shook that off and got seated.  My brother asked to split  a meal with his daughter as she is not a big eater.  He EXPLICITLY asked to use is Red Robin Rewards card for the APPETIZER special.  The other two girls and I ordered our burgers, and away went our server.  Things were a bit busy, so we didn't fuss about having a bit of a wait for our food.  The food was well prepared and enjoyable. But when my brother asked for a refill of fries for his daughter (whom he was sharing with) he was informed (and rather shortly) that it would be $1.99 for a refill since he was sharing with her. He said okay, but as she walked away both he and his daughter mentioned that when they'd been there before, both with and without my sister-in-law that they'd NEVER been charged for more fries when sharing with a child.  We waited in hopes that the manager would come by to check in with us so he could bring it up, but one never arrived. The wait for fries (both for my brother and his girl, and the other girls) was long.  When the server picked up a plate near me she slopped stuff off it onto the table, and barely even apologized (she stained a birthday card that I was waiting to hand my brother. We just generally felt like we weren't paid much attention too, and certainly that we did not get th service we usually see at Red Robin.  My brother meant to email the company, but wound up losing his receipt.  Our server got her tip, but it could have been a much bigger tip had she paid us a it more attention. Oh, and my brothers' rewards card was dinged for his FREE BURGER (which he was saving) rather than the APPETIZER SPECIAL that he asked for.  Dissapointing indeed.
The server was friendly but it took forever for the food to show up, and when it did, it seemed to be cool the fries were cold.

I cant really hate on Red Robin, they offer up a lot of veggie options with 2 different veggie patties (one vegan) and lots of substitution options for free. Service has been fast and friendly. Although the fries are bottomless I never find myself needing more than one batch. If you've got your hangry face on after leaving Ikea come here for a veggie burger.

By the time the hostess left after her "Your server's name is blah blah and she'll be with you shortly" speech, we realized our 5 year old was playing with the electronic device at the table (that we had zero experience with) - and Red Robin charged us $ for her 20 seconds of button pushing! When I alerted Red Robin about how ridiculous this was in a detailed form on the Red Robin website the manager's response was:  "Barbara,   Thank you for your recent feedback. We hope you enjoyed your visit with us at the Portland Airport Red Robin. We would love to hear about your dining experience. Please feel free to contact me directly at the restaurant. Wishing you a great day!   Thank you, Sean Kyhl" Yeah, we're NEVER GOING THERE AGAIN.  He either didn't bother reading what I wrote or didn't care and I will not support a business that both allows a 5 year old to rack up a bill WITHOUT PARENT PERMISSION and that ignores feedback when it comes.  Too bad, our 5 year old LOVES the bottomless broccoli.

Party of 4, 2 adults and 2 children. Drinks: 2 iced teas, a kids sprite and kids apple juice. Food: 2 plain kids cheeseburgers, one with fries, one with a salad and ranch dressing; one petite whiskey river bbq burger with fries, one tavern double burger with fries. We were seated in the dining area behind the hostess station and main entry. Our server was friendly and personable. I wish I had gotten her name because she was probably the nicest person there we came into contact with. We waited for over 20 minutes before our food arrived and none of it was served at appropriate temperatures, the burgers and fries were cold, the salad was warm and the ranch was too warm to be safe for consumption.  We asked to see the manager, but he was of no help nor did he actually listen to our concerns. Having been sitting at a nearby table, he arrived with a patronizing smile. We told him of the above and that we were not interested in eating our food and not at that location. He asked if he could remake our meals, to which we promptly declined. We told him of how other locations have often provided a basket of fries for our children to enjoy while we wait for our meals and how this was not offered here. We also told him the cleanliness of the establishment was not of the quality we are used to or expect from the  Red Robin company. The booths had not been cleaned properly after the last guests departed and needed to be swept out, there did not seem to be enough bus staff to provide quality and timely bus services which left many tables dirty and unoccupied. Overall, this location continues to provide lackluster service & appearance, underserved guests, disappointing servers and a quality of product undeserving of the Red Robin name. Management should be embarassed and corporate offices should be ashamed to be associated with this location.

My meal was pretty much slighty above average.  Ordered the mushroom burger, medium well which came out to well done.  The burger is very dry, not very juicy at all.  Funny how the pictures on the website and menu show the burger with tons of mushrooms but when you actually get it, not nearly as much.  The flavor was pretty good however, with the swiss cheese melted just right. I must say that the steak fries are good!  It's endless but how much fries can you eat?  The Red Robin seasoning is something that you should put on the fries. The service is quick and friendly.  Prices are about average.  This place is a good location and a place to go for a quick bite before going to PDX.
Once again a good burger made the way I wanted it. Solid customer service I actually recommend sitting at the bar for ease

What happened?  The 2 stars are the for the food- expected, but soggy fries. The experience? Well, just continue reading and you'll understand why I would give it only 1 star. After a long evening Christmas shopping, my sister and I decided to stop by Red Robin for a quick bite. Oh how I wish I just crossed the road and went to BWW instead.  While I was walking to the front door from the parking lot, peering in I saw that the dining room was half full. Good, we can get seated and get our food quick. Oh how wrong I was.  The hostess was standing in the front with a smug look on her face when I walked in. I told her it's going to be just the two of us. She looked behind her into the dining room and told us it's going to be a few minutes. A little confused, I just said okay and sat down. Maybe they were trying to figure out their server layout.  About 5 minutes later, the hostess got us and walked us to our seats. My sister and I sat at our seats for about 5 minutes and we already knew what we wanted to order. However, no one stopped by to say hi and they'll be back to get orders in a sec, nor did they get us water before they were off serving other people. We at in our seats for 30 minutes. 30 minutes. Of no one stopping to even say hi. We closed our menus and just sat there waiting for someone to come up and no one did. A bunch of other servers walked by and ignored our "we're ready" signal.  When our server FINALLY came by and said hi to us, he acted like us sitting there for 30 minutes was a normal occurrence. We made our orders and he walked away. The food came out about 20 minutes after that. Not only did he get my appetizer order wrong, he ordered the full size when I asked that I only wanted the appetizer size. When he delivered us our burgers, I asked if I can get some sauces on the side. He was gone for 20 minutes before he came back checking on us. I asked if he had our sauces he was startled because he forgot, came back with the wrong sauces and spent another 10 minutes to come back. He then topped off my water, but also topped off my sister's Sprite with water. Great. Thanks for ruining our meals AND our drinks.  I had to consistently remind him we wanted our checks and boxes so we can leave. Our planned hour dinner turned out to be an hour and half fiasco. Before when I worked off of Airport Way, my coworkers and I would always go to this Red Robin with no disappointment. I have no idea what happened. Maybe it was a bad night. Maybe it's new management? Whatever it is, I am super disappointed and will probably never come back.  If I'm hungry and I'm at Cascade Station, I would rather go to the Ikea cafeteria then stop by here.
Friendly service and an awesome burger with ghost pepper sauce. Bartender was just chatty enough to make the evening more enjoyable. Bottomless fries were bonus too!

Why, why, why do I not pay attention to the fact that this is a chain burger joint with a bar ?   I ordered fish & chips.   Trust me on this: only order fish in a seafood restaurant, preferably one within sight of an ocean, in order that the assumption of 'fresh' is realistic.   Otherwise, the service was OK ( sat in the bar ) and RR's fries are pretty good.  The corporate heads of this and some other chain eateries are reducing labor costs by placing self-service electronic touch pads ( Kindles from Hell ) on every table, to enhance ( not ) the dine-out experience with drink reorder commands, credit card payment options, and, as if you really need this if you have a game app on your smart phone, games-for-pay.  You can also call your server to the table with the touch pad.  I assume corporate prefers that wait staff be doing something other than strolling the floor, tending to the customers.   Maybe they're the ones overcooking the fish !

Frustrated!!!!!!!!!!! I should of use Yelp before choosing to eat here!! Waited 25 minutes and had to ask for a manager before someone showed up to take our order!! and the place is practically 40% empty!!! and.. no one refill our water!! The worst thing is that the couple came in, way after us, was waited on within 30 seconds.

The food was good, nothing spectacular. I had the vegan garden burger and fries, both came out at a decent speed and tasted good. My boyfriend ordered chicken and riblets, but was given riblets and mac & cheese (and no fries). The waitress fixed the order and didn't charge us, but the food took a while and by the time he got his fries, he was no longer interested. But he said the cookie milkshake was delicious -- the best part of the meal. The portions seem very small for a restaurant (especially one that serves mainly comfort food), and it was definitely overpriced. My boyfriend was given two chicken strips and handful of riblets and a handful of fries - which really isn't enough for someone over six feet. It's more than enough to eat at home but most people want to indulge when they eat out at a restaurant. We both were hungry again a couple hours later and the two of us was almost $30 all together. We would not return to this location.

Not a big burger person and I'm always a little confused about the hype surrounding this restaurant.  (Really....I have to wait for a table here....)  One of the upsides is they do have a full bar that helps kill the pain of having to eat here.   The food isn't good at all.  It appears to be overpriced bar food.  Ordered a quesadilla that was uncooked and the mushrooms were raw.  Several other people ordered items that I tried and was unimpressed with.  They do have a large desert menu, and a lot of hamburgers that caters to people who aren't adventurous eaters.   The restaurant is noisy and difficult to carry a conversation  in.  Conclusion:   It appears to be a good restaurant for children and the elderly.   Will only go here if I have to dine with one of the above.

Well, we made a mistake and came back here... 8:00 at night, ghost town and still over a 30 minute wait for our cold food. Price keeps going up here, decorations change, but the food was terrible. This location is the worst. Glad I didn't have a flight to catch! (Server was nice) we will try one of the other many places to eat in cascade station....
Awesome mushroom burger with bottomless sweet potato fries, outstanding burgers and fries. Great service, I hope they are all this good.

We love the burgers at Red Robin and my husband loves the unlimited root beer floats to go with them. We stopped at this location on our way to the airport.  The hamburgers were delicious and the floats just kept coming.  My favorite is the Banzai Burger.  Nothing out there beats it. Service was pretty good, not great but pretty good.  I know we'll be back again.

In my lovely and realist world Red Robins is over rated! Seriously you can make a better burger at home. But, I can understand the hype of it all for people who hate being in the kitchen. We ordered to go late one evening and our food took about 30-40 minutes which is entirely too long for a burger and chicken strips if you ask me. It was my boyfriends first time eating here and he liked it but he wasn't amazed like the commercial told him he would be. We ordered the double bacon cheese burger with fries and chicken strips with fries. Everything was just average and we ate it all so that's a good sign I suppose. Honestly it's just another Red Robins. Happy Yelping....

It's a standard food chain. Red Robin as a brand has tried hard to promote a new fresh look and it's not fooling anyone. I really wish the quality didn't go to shit compared to 4+ years ago. All the new design and extra things on the menu just covers up the poor quality they've gain with the food choice. I've tried this location on multiple occasions and it always seems to disappoint me.

What can I say that you don't already know? It's Red Robin- you come for the endless fries and stay as long as they will let you. This particular location isn't different. I would, however, recommend the sweet potato fries over their standard steak fries. But I might be on an island with that recommendation.  Also, be aware when ordering food for the kiddos that their fruit has added sugar... perfect

Having been to Red Robins in 15+ states I would rate this at the top of the list. The new make over looks good. Plenty of seating area. The restrooms were clean. The bar staff were quick and responsive.  The new electronic payment and game system worked well. My food was hot and tasted great.

I love the food of this chain in general. What sets each apart is the service and atmosphere. This location is lacking in both those areas. The bar area is very cramped and the service has been less than you'd normally expect.
Used to come here all the time. No longer a fan. Got food poising after I ate a burger. Wouldn't want to or recommend for anyone to come here. Plus all the menu is just burgers.
The Whiskey River Burger is completely off the chain. The bottomless fries with buzzard sauce is my go to fave. Finish with a root beer. Delicious.

Long story short, husband and i came here for dinner earlier tonight. We ordered ONE thing because we were splitting it. It took 20 minutes until someone told us the grill was "going out" and it'd be out soon. 30 min later we get our split burger made completely wrong. We started eating the french fries while we waited to let our waiter know what happened because we were starving. Our waiter was very apologetic and sincere which is the only plus to this whole thing. The manager came over to us and asked if we wanted the burger still. We politely said no because it wasn't what we ordered. The manager was emotionless and didn't apologize once. When we declined the burgers, all he said was "okay ill take it off your bill" and took the plates, with the french fries which we were eating, to the kitchen!! Didn't say a word to us after that so we just got up and left.  Its safe to say, i will NOT be back. Management is a joke here. I wish i was compensated for my time wasted.
Had Sombrero salad. The chicken had been sacrificed to some fire god and was indistinguishable from spicy rubber. Beer was cold and service good though.

Horrible.. love Red Robin but this was the worst experience I've had.  Waited 10 min for our server to take our drink order, 15 min later she came and got our food order(still no drinks) finally received our drinks, when food came we waited 12 min for last kids food to come.  Mini corn dogs were extremely burnt.  Manager said there was nothing he could do since the oil needed to be changed so future corn dogs would come out the same.  Waited for refills that we asked passing waiter for since our waitress was MIA.  Never received them.  We had a party of 7, after 10 min of waiting for someone to get check so I can pay the kids and other adults went outside to wait.  Took me over 15 min longer to pay.. so ridiculous.  I always talk this place up for a family dinner but not anymore.

After unsuccessfully attempting to get 2 basketball teams seated at IHOP on a Saturday morning without waiting 38 hrs to eat (Impossible... Yah I KNOW), my next call was to Ryan who informed us we could be seated with no problems. A brisk walk across the street and we were seated.  Kevin took care of the whole table, was on point with ALL the teenagers special requests and indecisiveness, AND wasn't skimpy on the drink/French fry refills. Food came out hot, delicious, and ALL of the orders were right!!! That NEVER happens! No, but seriously. Added bonus Ryan (who I believe was one of the managers), came by the table to ask if we had called and to make sure we were satisfied.   Great experience!

I usually enjoy Red Robin and over the years I've eaten at several of their locations in Arizona, California, Texas and Kansas and Oregon. The food is always good and with a very few exceptions the service is at least good.  This particular location provided my family with one of the few exceptions. We came in on a Monday evening around 7pm. The place was probably three-quarters full and didn't seem "busy". I've worked as a cook, as a server and as a bartender. This was a so-so Monday night for a chain restaurant in this location. We were greeted immediately and seated in the back. We then waited 15 minutes to be seen by a server and have our drink orders taken. Because we had the time, while waiting, we were ready to order our whole meal at that point. So we did.  15 minutes later, drinks arrive.  20 minutes later our server tells us that our order "never made it to the kitchen"... and asked us to order again. Which we did.  We've already been here longer than we expected without food and a hungry 3 year old. 20 minutes later our re-ordered food arrived and all was well until it was time to pay the check.  Our check arrives and we're told to use the pay station at the table. Except we can't because our check is wrong (double charged for a couple of items). So, we need a manager, so we wait... ultimately our check is corrected to exactly what was ordered. No offer of discount for inconvenience, no apology. Just a "here ya go, thanks for coming in". All-in-all the food was fine, but not worth the waiting or frustration. I don't like to write negative reviews and I'll probably go to Red Robin again, but probably not this location.

Stellar location! Normally with a chain restaurant I pick the one closest to me that I usually go to.  I've written a few for the Clackamas location, but this one deserves its own review. Met some friends here for dinner and drinks and we really had a nice time.  Great service, highly attentive and always smiling.  This was the first time in the last six visits to a Red Robin that they got my order right, the food was hot, and we all enjoyed everything.  Super clean location too, including the restrooms which is important to me. It's a very busy location here, near the airport and airport hotels.  Not a lot of eating choices, so flyers know a go-to spot like a Red Robin.  Plus, they bring in the Vancouver crowd that doesn't mind a quick trip over the bridge to save some tax cash.  Overall I was really impressed with the efficiency, speed, and attentiveness of everything.  While I cannot speak for all the locations, this one is far superior to the ones I've been to.  Obviously they've made great strides in hiring good people here, and managers have taken 'process flow' to heart. Negatives?  A few minor things.  As I said they do get busy, and there are times when waiting will be an issue so be prepared or send a friend over early to grab a table like we did.  Also, I am not a fan at all of the new trend in chain restaurants to have the table side electronic order computer.  You can use it to order appetizers, drinks, and you are forced to use it when paying by debit/credit card.  This is where they lose a star from this reviewer.  I find it disrespectful to me as a customer.  There's a reason I'm tipping the wait staff..........for service.  I realize these new computers at the table save money for the company and end up with add-on sales($1.99 to play games), but it's really silly and I don't think it's very nice at all.  However, this did not distract from my experience with my server or my meal to be fair. Overall, great Red Robin, and I wouldn't hesitate to return and suggest it to others.  We were left literally saying, "Man, that's a good burger".  A winner in my book!

We have eaten here a number of times over the past few years. This is our favorite location for this restaurant. Staff has always been friendly. Food has been good, and service has been good. Enjoy coming here.

Went to this location for lunch today during my lunch hour. Server was pleasant but pretty absent. No refills offered, as we didn't see him after taking our order until food arrived almost an hour later. No apologies or updates offered on progress of food. Took the food to go since I didn't have time to sit and eat at that point. Also, no apologies offered after expressing that it took and excessive amount of time to arrive. As I started to pack my food into the provided to go container, I realized it was ice cold (Bacon cheeseburger lettuce wrap) even the burger patty. For a work lunch, this doesn't work for me. Probably wont go back and probably will let everyone know about this experience.

Last 3 times a have been to RR it has been bad. This is different locations as well. Since making all of the changes food is much more expensive and quality is way down. $15 Burger I had at this location was sitting in a pool is sauce.  It was so soggy and falling apart I had to use a fork. We ordered a milkshake with appetizer and it can at end of the meal as we were about to leave. When we arrived not busy right when opened. Service was horrible. We waited 20 minutes to get service at our table. Ordered water, iced tea and milkshake. Not difficult. One didn't even show up the tea wasn't even brewed. Since it was so bad we ordered our food while server was there in case she didn't come back.  There were other people who sat down before and ordered at same time as us who never got their food until we were leaving. Lots of tables were seated and ate then left before us and the other table got their food. Then it was crappy. I can get a better burger for Half the price at Wendy's.  Had to ask for silverware and napkins. They served our food without it. Had to get up and find someone to poor water, had to find someone to get fries.  Go back to old ways. Baskets no fry rings which is a joke. Serve good hot food with good service, at a reasonable price.  The atmosphere isn't pleasant either. Save time and money go to any fast food place. Better service and better food, and more appropriately priced.

I like some Red Robin. It felt like here is one on every street corner in OR. Not a bad thing. I will always go to a RR before even thinking about McDonald's. I walked on a Tuesday night around 1900. THis place was packed. I had time to kill before my redeye back to ATL. The food was good and everything came out hot and delicious.

When you here, you pretty much have your mind set in what to order... This location, however, feels somewhat crowded and the staff kinda hurries you a bit to get the other folks in the table. Solid 3 stars...

Was seated by a friendly hostess........ Our order was taken by Sara.........she was friendly and when I wanted to try another sauce other than campfire sauce she offered another one in addition to that one - thought that was awesome.  She brought us our drinks. Then one of the line chefs brought my dinner salad out then a totally different person brought out our meal immediately after the salad person.    As I ate a few of the larger fries which were thrown in the basket on top of the much smaller AND hard ones (almost like leftovers) which were underneath the fish I decided to capture Sara's attention and showed her what was in my basket.  She gracefully brought a basket of fries to the table.   Towards the end of our meal a bus person asked if they could take my plate - although I was still biting into my food - what the hell?! Later, Sara asked if we wanted dessert. We said no thank you and that we were ready to go and if we could get the bill.  Sara then brought us a second round of drinks hmmm............not sure what this was all about. I tried to take into consideration that they were  busy but  this location has always been busy when we have visited in the past and never ran into the above.   I am hoping that this was just a fluke and that they are not following the pattern of some of the other Red Robins I have visited recently that started out this way. This is our favorite restaurant to visit while in the Portland area.  Like the old saying goes though................"they're not the only ones" :) MAYBE THEY NEED A BIGGER FACILITY and  the chefs need to think as if they were the customer "would I want these skimpy, hard, almost stale fries?"

Do not eat here!! First off, my family and I ate here because we had just gotten off a plane from a long trip home and we were hungry. When we got here we were seated next to the kitchen and we all ordered water and what each of us wanted to eat. We each almost immediately downed our water and then had to wait for forever for them to even notice our water was empty. After about 10 mins, they brought out the onion rings we'd ordered and they were completely burnt. But we were just so hungry we didn't care. After another 10 mins they served half of us our food. My mom got her fish and chips and they were completely burnt to the point she couldn't even bite into it. On top of that my dads fries were completely cold and our table and two tables next to us had empty Catsup bottles. The bathrooms were disgusting as well, the trash was overflowing onto the floor and there were paper towels and toilet paper everywhere. On top of that, while waiting for our food, we could see the waiters and cooks all just standing around talking. This was a very disappointing visit and we left before they even had started making the rest of our food.

Awww! RR made sure I made it to my flight on time, comped mine and my boyfriends tab for a long wait and long wait for food! So awesome:) and my food came out perfect. The staff were very attentive, and professional! Yummmmmmmm!

This was the typical red robin experience. The service was slow but they didn't come by every 2 minutes asking if everything was alright, which I like. Food is great. If you haven't been to red robin then you're missing out. Check this one out if you're headed to the airport.

We did not like Red Robin since the first experience at Washington square mall. The server there was terrible and rude. Don't remember his name.  So because my wife loves Red Robin, we tried it again near Clackamas Mall. We had a wonderful experience with the server. The food was good and our server was the best.  This is also a message to the management of Red Robin: you guy have to come and check out your business partners everyplace, not just assume they are all good.

This is not my favorite Red Robin to go to but it is just a car ride over the bridge and plus I don't have to pay tax on the food.   However,  the bar in this Red Robin is very small and they only have two tiny booths.  The rest of the seating is just table and chairs.  It is also really cold in the bar because it's right next to the door.    I also don't like that you have to walk all the way around the restaurant to get to the front door from the parking lot.    The food is consistent but the atmosphere at this Red Robin makes it less appealing.

Within a few short weeks after the conclusion of our Portugal Honeymoon, I'm back up in Portland tonight in preparation for a Parent-Teacher Conference on Monday. My son and I are staying at the Aloft Hotel across the street from this Red Robin, which turns out to be one of his favourite burger joints. He had his usual Whiskey River BBQ Burger, plus a large ginger shake. I stayed true to my Blue Cheese ground beef roots. That plus the "Bottomless Fries" and a 22 ounce glass of Widmer Amber, not only filled me up, but put me in a better mood after Cal's close loss to the Ducks today. My son warned me that service could be slow here, but I found it to be prompt and friendly. We both left happy and stuffed and ready to putter around the Hotel Lobby on this very satisfying Father-Son experience.

An absolute gem. It's your basic Red Robin. Very new interior, and a great staff! Even though I came during the busy lunch rush, the staff made sure my entire visit ran smoothly. I'll definitely be back.

OK, the servers here; HOT. Customer service here is top notch. Their burgers are amazing, and I know its a corporate food chain, but I can't help it, I love Red Robin, Yummmm.  The friendliest server in the whole wide world; Joey, was working in the lounge/bar, and he is tits. His service, tits. His character, tits. He's just tits, and he makes that place; you guessed it, tits. You are doing this gentleman a disservice if you don't experience it through his skittles.  I always get the same thing, and I know they have a lot to offer, but I like the bacon cheese burger, but I like to sub Gorgonzola cheese, or bleu cheese if you wanna be a dick about  it, in place of murika cheese.  I know, I know, there is a bacon bleu burger here, but it is not as good as just doing it my way. Alright,  enough about tits and burgers, get down there today, or now, right now in fact. Oh the girls working there are a bunch of cuties too! No offense to any of the female servers working here. I'm sure you're tits too. I just only got to experience it with Sir Joey. Next time I'm in, if he's not working, I'll have to put one of you to the test.

What a disappointment. RR has always been really great. Food hot and fresh,  service pretty good even when busy which they always are. This weekend we where seated with a view of the counter where food was placed for pickup. As we sat and waited for our order I kept and eye on the food that was left sitting for a good 10 minutes under the warming lights before it was picked up and watched to see where it was headed.... right to our table. our food was cold, COLD. And what is with all the extra crap on my plate? Food, just food on the plate please. I don't need additional accouterments with my food. I mean WTH is that metal thing my fries are stuck in? Its not appealing, certainly not needed.. Gordon Ramsay ran through my head.. "What would he say about this?.." Well, I do like RR but I won't be back to this location. Nothing good to say about it.. Nothing at all.

If it were physically possible, I would probably do nothing with my life except eat Red Robin every minute of every day.  My friend and I just road tripped cross-country to end up in Portland, and were pretty sick of burgers by the end of it.  However, we'd both heard of the famed Red Robin and its magical nomz, and decided we might as well give it a go.  Neither of us knew quite what to expect, kind of like when you go to the clinic after a night with a rather scandalous woman.  Thankfully, this situation turned out wonderfully and exceeded all of our greatest expectations.  We both had the tried and true cheeseburger, their classic.  My friend particularly enjoyed the holder that the fries came in, remarking, "I would steal this if it weren't so heavy.  It would probably set my bag over the weight limit on my flight home."  A+ for presentation, Red Robin.  You did good.

As with all chain restaurants, decent food combined with average food means 3 stars. Having just arrived in Portland after a long drive and messed up check in at the Aloft hotel (that's another story), we were hungry and wanted to get dinner somewhere close. Unfortunately, that was also 4th July night so many restaurants were closed or were closed early but not Red Robin.  Food is of course burgers but not feeling like a burger that night, I go with the fish and chips. Fish was average and bordered on dry. The key to good fish in fish and chips are a super fresh fish fried in good batter. Maybe that's too much to ask at a burger place. Oh well, it's a chain restaurant after all so don't have high expectations. Decent if you want something safe and quick.

I haven't had Red Robin since I left SD so when I drove by it nearby the airport I had to come back!!  This location is near the shopping area, which has a lot of places to check out.  The restaurant looks like all the other red robin.  Once seated I ordered the freckled lemonade, which I miss!!  It's so yummy with actual strawberries inside!  Love the free refills too!  I got my usual crispy chicken sandwich with the extra ranch and plate full of fries with the red robin secret sauce.  It was just as delicious as I remember it!  Service here was great and fast. Definitely a great chain restaurant that I miss!

Every time I get seated in one of these I always feel like I should be there to chaperon the hoards of 17 year olds after the football game or something (place is always packed to the point of almost overwhelming) I'm in my mid to late thirties and I feel too old for this place about 90 percent of the time. It's not too pricey, but it's not exactly cheap even by fast casual standards either. The budget burger on the menu would be 'Reds tavern burger' which really seems a step down from Carl's Jr type of fare. My girlfriend loves the towering onion rings, but what kills it for me is the atmosphere beyond anything else.

I always love red robins!!  Their Jalapeno appetizer is excellent! It is really crunch and spicy, and deeping sauce is matching with that jalapeno, so this spicy and creamy combination makes me feel great!! Also, I usually order chicken burger with deep fried onion strips inside burger, and it is so delicious! I had chicken wing, and ribs, pop corn shirmp, and every single menu are really fresh and they have their special know-how. I love their honey mustard sauce!! it is really soft, and I have never had that kinda sauces. it has poppy seed, and it is perfect match with potato edge. :)  Also every cashier is willling to help us, and they are always smile and friendly :)
They have really slipped ... service was poor , food was blah ... what happened ???? Red robin was a fun place to go ....
Service was ho hum... It lacked any personal touch, kindness or suggestive selling. She even dropped off our check before I could order another drink and we were sitting in the bar/lounge area...

We have been here for an hour. Service has been very slow. I would not recommend large groups. Sitting and watching others come in after you and get food before you is not a good experience. Drinks have taken over 10 minutes multiple times on this visit. With other places in the area I will not be stopping in here agin. I will say this other Red Robins are typically not this slow. I hope they figure this out.

My family loves Red Robin.  We always enjoy going as a family because the kids have fun and enjoy looking at the decor and their kids menu is really fun and full of good and healthy (as well as unhealthy) options. My personal favorite guilty pleasure at Red Robin is the jalapeno medallion starter.  My daughter and I like to go to Red Robin on special occasions and split a milkshake and an appetizer. There is so much food offered in one appetizer that if we order one, we rarely order anything else (other than a milkshake to share). Red Robin has a consistent burger.  Overall for a family with kids, this place is a really good option.

I think I might sound like I'm getting old here but it seems to me that the menu price inflation at Red Robin is probably twice as much as anywhere else. I'm confident it wasn't long ago that a burger, fries and soda with tip ran under $15. Now it's probably $22. This particular location is almost always slammed. To their credit they have hired a LOT of people making everything fairly efficient. However I've never come in without having to wait 10 to 20 minutes for a table. Even the bar is typically full. Parking is also usually a bitch now. And for the love of God they took out the door that was actually facing the parking lot and you  now have to walk all the way around to the "front" door. I don't mean to sound lazy but if it's raining and by the time you find a spot to park and walk around to this door you're going to be soaked. I'm also of the opinion that they've really started to produce cheaper and greasier food. I think it's a trend and I'm not a fan.

Went here with my family before they went back to New Mexico.  Had horrible service but good food so I wrote Red Robin.  When giving feedback to chains on their massive websites, I don't expect to hear back - they're so busy all the time, what's one more customer? I did hear back and was quite impressed with the level of management.  It's not easy managing a floor of 10 servers without something falling through the cracks.  So how a restaurant handles a poor experience speaks to the culture of the company.  The manager took my feedback, did not place blame, took responsibility and remedied the situation.   Red Robin is a place where our kids like to spend their birthdays and also is our go to place when we dine out as a family so we'll be back again.  Normally their service is on point so I believe it was a unusual incident but all in all handled very well.

Came to have dinner on a Sunday night.   The place was by no means busy.   It took an hour to get our dinner.   An hour!  The waiter was nice enough.   Can't hardly blame him for the kitchen staff being slow.   Some offer of dessert or drink to compensate for the time would have been nice.
Arguably my favorite chain restaurant of all time.  Predictable and consistent, no matter where I end up I can find a place to eat as long as they have a red robin.

It's a cool place to stop into after shopping around Cascades Station, or flying into PDX Airport. There are TVs but I don't find it as loud as Buffalo Wild Wings, so you can carry a conversation with friends, (not shout to hear each other).  The burgers are fine, the fries I find will fill the belly quick, so I usually get the onion rings, (unless I just want fries). Love the Mint Brownie shake.

So, really nothing special. Average chain, with average service, and average food... If you like steak fries, this is the place to go. Endless supply!!  Which I can't even get through my first round.. Go figure. What a deal. One great thing about Red Robin, They serve GIANT beers :) Cheers!!!

I have been to multiple red robins and this one by far had the worse Service.  all the waiters/ waitresses just hovered by the bar and talked while ignoring the customers. And to top it of my food was cold!!!!!!! Stop talkin and do your job!!

Despite my predisposition, lunch here did not suck! Our server was engaging, the food was tasty enough and they poured 10 Barrel. Local is still better, but amid the strip-mall sterility that is Cascade Station, this chain spot is a relatively good option.

I do not understand why people write bad reviews for restaurants because they do not like the idea of a "chain restaurant", or dont like the ethics of the restaurant business. If you do not like it then go elsewhere, simple as that. Do not write a review (which is supposed to be about your dining expirience) about your opinions on chain restaurants.

Much like Jules Winfield from "Pulp Fiction", I'm pretty much a vegetarian, but I do love the taste of a good burger. Unfortunately, their veggie burgers are standard fare (Gardenburger or Boca, not homemade), so I shied away and went with a full-fledged meat burger, the Prime Chophouse to be precise. It was pretty fantastic. The bottomless steak fries are a huge plus. The only cons I can think of are the priciness and the lack of decent veggie burger options. Heck, I'd be willing to put up with the priciness if they offer a fresh, homemade veggie burger option. Regardless, it's not bad and I'd definitely be back if there's one in the neighborhood.
Great burgers! Lot's of bun options, lo carb versions.. Not a fan of their specialy drinks, but the burgers are great!

Came here as a last resort since it was across the street from our hotel. We got there an hour before closing. The hostess had no personality. The waiter was pretty good. But the silverware and cups at our table were dirty, the milkshakes werent worth the price, and the food was just ok.

This place is close by and I go there often. I usually sit at the bar top since it's just me and I don't want to take a whole table. The bartenders, Bert, Chris, and Malicka (sorry I spelled that wrong) are all great. The burgers are great.

OK, i was lazy and didn't want to go search out a much finer local dining experience. This Red Robin is close to the airport, hotels and other shopping needs. Laziness kicked in and was welcomed by good, if not cheesy, customer service, good food and decent prices. Next time I'm in Portland, I promise not to be lazy. But in the meantime, I can always count on having several birthdays celebrated at Red Robin. PS: The bartender Cecilia was excellent. She was friendly, on top of things and didn't mess around. Kudos to her.

The food was edible (which is saying something for a chain restaurant) but the service was HORRIBLE. They ran out of silverware, so my entire family including visiting grandparents had to eat with our fingers until about halfway through the meal. I wanted to split a dessert with my girlfriend and we settled on the apple pie. The waitress goes away for a minute and then comes back and says they've run out of the "cripsy crunchy pieces that go on top". Basically, the good stuff was gone. And now we all know where these pies are made...somewhere definitely not in the restaurant. The only reason we went to this Red Robin in the first place was because it was within walking distance of the hotel my grandparents were staying at and everything else was closed. I feel bad for my gramps who insisted on picking up the check.  Do not eat here!

I ate at Red Robin with my wife and had great fish and chips although normally we love there burgers.  Rosa our waitress was particularly good and helpful.  If you want good American "classic" food and a great variety of beers (not quite the micro brew standard but a decent selection) then Red Robin is pretty reliable.

Why do I keep coming here? It sounds so good when you are hungry..then immediatly after the self loathing begins. My burger was bad. My fries were salty. My server was 16. No thanks. Damnit, learn my lesson!

Went to Red Robin Cascade Station recently for dinner with our two young boys.  We were seated quickly and received initial drinks and appetizer relatively quickly, and then we sat, and sat, and sat...45 minutes after ordering our food and it still not being out we asked waitress to check on it (she had not noticed how long we had been sitting).  When she checked on it she stated that only half of our order had come up (not sure why she didn't notice it), and the other half was missing and the cook didn't ever see it.  Therefore, the first half that was cooked was now cold.  She stated the manager would come over to talk to us (we though perhaps to give us some credit for the extreme wait time) and cook would make food now and try to rush.  The manager came over and gave us some free fries (like that is a good exchange for our entire dinner being missing), and was on his way again.  We waited probably another 15 minutes for food to be prepared...overall the whole dinner process took about 2 hours, which is ridiculous and unacceptable with two young children.  We won't be frequenting this Red Robin that's for sure.

I've been to several of these but I was less than impressed with this location. I finished my lunch and instead of bringing me the check, the waitress brings me a soda. I didn't ask for one. I had my wallet out and wanted to leave. The lunch I had wasn't that great. Usually I order a chicken sandwich and fries but I'm trying to be healthier so I ordered the chicken special. The chicken had good flavor but the salad that came with it was lacking. And for the price I should have gotten more food. Granted I knew I wasn't going to get blown away with good food here. But the service and the food wasn't up to the average, even for a chain like this.

Red Robin FTW- Seriously I've loved Red Robin since I was like 10.  The food is amazing. Their burgers are colossal( served w/ bottomless,delicious fries). I usually order the basic Cheeseburger however I really like the burger w/ bacon and pineapple( the 'Don Hoe"?).  Aside from burgers the Fiesta salad is pretty  tasty. Service is always friendly and helpful. My Mom and I used to come to the Portland airport (from Eugene) like 3 times a month( for over 5 years) to make deliveries, and we loved to have lunch at Red Robin.  Until this location opened up, we ate at the Clackamas Town center location,  so this location is super convenient when dropping off/picking up people and things via the airport.   Regardless of the location, Red Robin is Awesome

Red Robin, home of the smiling burger. Put it in your face, and you'll smile too! It has been about a year since my last special guest appearance at any Red Robin, particularly this location, and for reasons unmentioned let's just say that they left a lot to be desired - In every category of food and service However, they really redeemed themselves with this experience: * The packed dining room was no match for our superhero server - less than a 5 minute wait, and it was a holiday! * Our drinks were truly bottomless, we never had to ask for a refill * Appetizers came fresh out of the fryer and to our table (1/2 order selections are perfect) * Clean table, silverware and glassware * Our server was fast and efficient Oh, and most importantly,  I came home with a helium balloon. For all the people eating, chatting, or pre-shopping IKEA on their laptop, we never felt rushed. If they keep up this consistent level of service we'll be repeat customers!

This is a favorite of my. I love the upbeat atmosphere.  If Im looking for a quiet place I go somewhere else. But this place is always lively. I like there food and bottomless fries. I love the strawberry lemonade. and there mint chocolate shakes. I come here often. the service is friendly. I even like their clam chowder.  Parking is adequate on the back side. Its a short walk to the front door.

You know, I like to hate on corporate restaurants (disclosure: I work at one) but hit me up with some endless fries, crazy amounts of sauce and milkshakes that are pretty tasty and I won't complain. I won't rave but I won't complain.

This place is fantastic if you're in the mood to really pig out!  They have great bottomless fries and drinks.  This was only the second time I'd been to a Red Robin and I learned my lesson the first time: be careful not to over eat! Our server was quick and friendly, and got us in and out quickly without making us feel rushed.   He helped me with a special order to make my "burger" vegan and didn't mess up a thing!  I ordered my burger in lettuce rather than the bun to help me not get so stuffed and I highly recommend it.  I was afraid it would be messy, but the way they wrapped it made it easy to eat and quite tasty!

From the time this Red Robin opened until about four months ago, every visit merited a four or five star.  The last three visits have been one or two star.  The remodel looks great, but the service is now super-slow, long wait for the food to arrive, and the fries are, at best, lukewarm.  I used to eat here twice per month.  Not anymore, sad to say.

Went in for a burger on a business trip.  I asked the waitress for medium rare, she said "we dont do that here, its either a little pink or no pink"  what in gods green earth is she talking about.  the waitress was obviously parroting her script, but she acted like a complete ditz.  mind you she was sweet as southern tea, but needed some help.  The burger came out rare to med rare which is what I wanted but not sure if it was do to anything i tried to say or explain to her.
Great service! My server was very attentive, apologized for the change in servers and make sure we got our food on time!! I will eat here again!!

Burger was good, but... I specifically asked for extra fries, and was assured "oh we put double fries in every take out order". Uh huh. Thanks for my 10 fries. Does this mean a normal order has 5? Not impressed, Red Robin.

*Disclaimer* I can actually appreciate Red Robin when I go for something other then their hamburgers. That's right, I go to a burger joint for salads, chicken, or turkey. I always have the worst luck when it comes to Red Robin and how they cook the burgers. I always ask for well done. I would much rather have it be charcoal instead of pink. Can't help it. It makes me afraid. Anyways, it's always pretty rare. One time even there was some blood that ran out of the wrapper of my gourmet burger. No worries though, it didn't happen at this specific location but hey, I don't want to risk it again. I had taken my grammy shopping the other day just because she hardly gets into Portland to take advantage of the whole no tax thing. It was around 11:30 and we could smell something tasty. Grammy also hardly gets to eat out so she was like, "let's go there" as she points to RR. I'm not too big of a fan but hey, she has only ever been two or three times to a Vancouver location.  I figured it was going to be really busy since we were there so close to lunch. Instead we got seated right away and they even had a section closed down. I didn't know it was possible for a Red Robin to be slow...possibly because for once I wasn't in the Couve burbs! We had a super nice waiter plus the rest of the staff just seemed super friendly. Maybe it helped that they hadn't been open for very long yet so they weren't so surly with the customers yet but hey, I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt. I advised her to avoid any cow products so she went with the turkey burger and I went with the blackened chicken burger. Both were delicious but then again, we were really hungry.  Best part of the meal -- Grammy has never seen a TV in the floor before. She even almost fell by trying to avoid it while heading to the restroom. She was in awe the rest of the day! Thank you RR for providing us some great entertainment.
