Great place with great service. Its nice to have a sit down burger place near shopping. Love the cantina jack style burger!!! Staff was fast and friendly and kept the drink and fry refills coming.

Second time here this week, will be last.  Ordered my beer and water 30 mins ago, took order, still no food or drinks, even water.  About to walk out.  Almost this bad a few days ago, food tasted decent but most of it was cold.

We usually eat here before we fly out of PDX because we stay across the street at Aloft.  Their new smoked bacon burger is to die for. Service is so-so, and run-of-the-mill. Not outstanding, but not too bad.  The drinks are really hit and miss. Sometimes they are great, other times they are horrible.  The last time our mixed drinks were the worst we've ever had. Horrible.  The time before they were fine.  RR needs to spend some find training their bartenders.  Overall not bad. Could use some improvement.

I enjoy this RR. I hate the ones in Vancouver since all of them have slow, poor customer service. This one, although is right across the bridge from 'couv, its a completely different experience than those from Washington. The waiter was attentive, read my mind on a lot such as filling the glass before its empty, bringing extra honey mustard dressing (the best dressing I must say for your fries) I will be coming back. Even when this place is packed, we didnt get treated any different.

Working nearby this is my go-to lunch and happy hour local.  Liz (one of the bartenders) is top notch and provides excellent service. I'm always impressed with how willing all the staff is with my unusual paleo/primal/keto burger orders (hold the bun,no fries,salad,etc).  Overall Great service for a chain restaurant and a place I will go again.

I'm not a big fan of Red Robin but I was hungry and I just flew into town.  This place was quite busy so I sat at the bar for my meal.  Service was quick and my grilled chicken sandwich was quite good with piping hot fries.   My beer was good and cold.

For starters this location is out by IKEA and PDX airport.  This is the only chain restaurant I will support aside from Cheesecake Factory. The food is consistently good with delicious burgers that don't disappoint.  The milkshakes and fries are always just right as well.  The service at this location was spot on which was slightly surprising since I visited shortly after their grand opening. That is usually when front of house is working out the kinks. Not here! They took off running!  I have been back since and had excellent service again. Their bar drinks were stronger than other locations too.  Get the Whiskey River BBQ Burger, it won't let you down!

Hunger desperation over at Cascade Station gives you few options that aren't of the chain variety, so my husband & I bit the bullet and stopped in at Red Robin. Nice hostess up front and quick seating, but the waiter we had was so chipper to the point of obnoxious (getting into our business, jumping in on our conversation with each other, super loud, etc.) that it was seriously annoying. Surprised to see no healthy options section on the menu, like most of these places do, so took a guess on calories and got the bbq chicken wrap with a side salad instead of fries. The wrap was actually pretty decent, but the salad was just iceberg lettuce with one cucumber and two lonely croutons - get some real greens and this coulda been good, folks! My husband's guacamole burger unfortunately only had about a 1/2 tsp of guac on it. The music was loud, the food was nothing to write home about, so we'll pass next time we're out here.

I took family here for a break from the holiday turkey and stuffing. It was perfect and convenient since it was close to the airport. My husband and I eat at Red Robin regularly enough to say we have tried everything on the menu even, their seasonal burgers. We have been to several in the Portland area. I've even been to Red Robins from Florida to Washington State, so I feel as though I know their food well. I also know when their food changes. I ate at this location last week and order my usual Bonsai Burger, I have eaten this burger enough that my palate has memorized the flavor. This visit, the meat was completely different. It was not the typical REAL meaty patty, where they ask you how you want it cooked- it was a pressed, dry, over cooked, rubbery patty that left me with the same after taste as Burger King and McDonald's. It was less than half the normal size and the bread practically swallowed the patty. Typically we are stuffed after our burgers and fries, but we ALL left hungry experiencing the same odd after taste and dissatisfied with the over priced Burger King/McDonald's patty. I don't know if the big change has change owners, or the cost of beef has affected their quality, but this is the kiss of death for me. Paying nearly 11/12$ for a burger that is no better quality than fast food is frustrating and a rip off. I don't know if this change is for good, or just temporary. The fries were also half the order, I don't know if this is to cute down on waste or again a permanent change in quality. While I was dissatisfied with my food, the service was wonderful. I hope this change is temporary, Red Robin is my favorite burger stop.

You know, Red Robin is the typical formula for a chain restaurant.   They have a good selection burgers, you can basically get one anyway you want it.  They will sub a veggie patty or boca burger on anyone at no extra charge. Fries are steak fries and bottomless.  If you sub a salad for the fries with your meal I have found that they don't completely skimp out on it, it is pretty decent, although not as big as a full size side salad. You can also sub a veggie patty or boca burger on any of the entree salads that have meat.  I haven't really ventured out and tried any of the non-burger meals as I view RR to be a burger joint and only go there for that reason.

God WHY do I make the same mistake more than once?!  It's really annoying!  Sub-par food, slow wait staff, and why even bother asking me how pink I'd like it when you cook it all well done anyway, every time??  I got a 5.99 margarita, the first was ok, the second I sent back because they overdid the grand marnier and I couldn't taste the tequila.  Blah.  I won't be back.

For those who really have not had a gourmet burger in their lifetime, this is the best place for many to go. More often than not, everyone else wants to go here and not me. The food is decent, I have had worse, but it is usually very busy at this location and it just seems to take forever. The food is not always as accurate as the picture of the order by the time it gets to you. Seems as though the staff are in too big of a hurry to get it out, rather than correct. Kind of an oxy-moron from the above statement. Maybe they should get it correct and then I can complain about the length of time to get my food.

Terrible. Ordered take out. We got a salad, sandwich and 4 kids meals to take back to our hotel room. My husband returned with no forks and no drinks for the kids' meals. So, lesson learned.....check your bag! It was also way too expensive for the quality of food. We should have known better but wanted something quick to pick up.

Ok....the 2 stars comes from my personal hatred of chain places (enough already!!!) but again...they are close to work... Now...I have only eaten at this Red Robin one time... I went there to get 2 salads for me and my boss.... I ordered the asian chicken one and a cob salad for Brett with no blue cheese on his and no cilantro on mine (I am TERRIBLY allergic) They looked ok....but took 20 minutes to get....I took them back to the office....I was SO hungry....poured my dressing on and took a huge bite...and guess what was all over it.... You got it...cilantro!!  I went to my locker and took some medication to keep myself from having a terrible reaction and went back to Red Robin with salad in hand. When I had been waiting...the bartender was super nice so in my purchase of the salads...I tipped him 5 bucks...he looked like he might have been having a rough day but didnt let it come through in his treatment of employees or customers.... Well...I went right back to him and he was so apologetic and took the salad back...I did not want a salad at this point because I was freaked out...so I got a BBQ chicken wrap.... The manager came out and totally apologized and was very gracious...told me he spoke to the kitchen staff and it would never happen again... The bartender returned my money (I was honestly not expecting that!!) and I left with my wrap.... I sadly still got very sick from the original bite...but I was pleased with the service I received originally and when I returned... Again...I am a hater of chains....but then you Red Robin for hiring nice people....

This was my first time visiting this location and I was pleasantly surprised. We were famished after an exhausting IKEA excursion and weren't in the mood for Swedish meatballs. So we drove around and found Red Robin to be the closest place to to get some grub.  The service was excellent and the food was much better than I expected. For some reason, food quality has seemed to go downhill at the Clackamas location we usually go to. But here, my friend and I had Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wraps and they were absolutely delicious. Our server was friendly and attentive. It was all good!

Lame! How do you serve something with NO flavor?   I had to dip my sandwich in ranch and ketchup just so I could taste something.$9 for a margarita which was pretty much all ice. Waitress was not overly friendly. Handed us our ticket  and not even a thank you.Waste of time and waste of $$. Blah- wont eat there again!
Love Red Robin!  Had the seafood platter.   Cod, shrimp and claim strips were very good.  The service was excellent.  Our drinks were never empty.  The server even offered to get us a to go cup.

Ughhh, now I remember why it had been a decade since my last time here. The food wasn't horrible, but man, I know that we all have bad days, but the server was just not helpful at all. Made our group feel like we were a burden to even be there. It's too bad, if anything this experience made me like Red Robin even less.

I mean, the food is not bad. I just hate myself a little every time we end up going here. I just know there is some horrible factory farm where they do bad things to animals. I'm no vegetarian, but really, do we need crappy bland chain places like this in the world? At least don't go too often, please?

I have officially eaten way to many meals at Red Robin.  I'm not exactly sure what the atmosphere they are trying to pull off at the place, but it's what I like to call "Schizophrenic Americana."  The food is lackluster, and the major redeeming quality is the MSG laden seasoning salt.

Convenient location for my job near the airport and a participator in the Red Robin e-club Free Birthday Burger! The staff was very, very friendly to me, especially considering no one was making any money off of me. Next time I have a jones for their tasty French Onion Soup or Onion Ring Tower I'll be sure to head over to the Red Robin in Cascade Station.

Yuck Yuck yuck!  The only thing that was good here was our 2 $7.00 22oz beers. I ordered a spicy burger that came with crispy fried Jalapeno discs, pepper jack cheese, tomato and lettuce, my husband ordered the $14 prime rib (I think not) French Dip.  We waited at least 20 minutes for a food runner to deliver the food.   The sweet potato fries were stone cold, they were the consistency of something straight out of a refrigerator.  The only thing crunchy on my burger was the salt crunching between my teeth. The rest of the lukewarm burger was just mush.  McDonalds puts out a better burger, and for only $1.   My husband ate half of his French Dip and could not eat anymore, it had salt and grease everywhere.  And for 14 bucks I would want my sandwich to be bigger, I think it probably had about 3 oz of meat on it, and there was nothing PRIME about the meat, it had the consistency of frozen beef product.  The only flavors we tasted were salt and grease.  On a positive note they did not charge us for the grease and salt dip, and we have the knowledge to NEVER EVER eat here again.

This place is not worth going to, just skip it and go anyplace near by. The chips and salsa came with hamburger relish, the waiter was like " oh sorry"  and it was still on the bill, never going back to any Red Robin! Ever, ever, ever!!!!

Really- a bunch of one star reviews?  We eat here frequently (when we stay at the Aloft across the street or go to Ikea to shop) and have always had great food, friendly and prompt service and a great margarita.  They have gluten free buns and even separate the fries so they aren't cross contaminated when cooking.
our experience is so much better than the first time. the waitress was excellent. the food was warm and good. not complaining this time.

i have never given a bad review. i tend to stay pretty positive and try to find the humor in a seemingly bland situation, but i can't stay mum about this place.  my father and law, my 2 year old and i  were starving after a  day at ikea ( we got lost in there)  and decided burgers was out best bet and hay it said gourmet burgers too! upon arriving it seemed like the best choice, balloons and colors for the babe  and a relaxed family environment.  the waitress takes our order : a gourmet cheeseburger, a crispy chicken burger and a kids cheese burger and fries.   At this point all seemed well, then the clock began ticking and almost 40 minutes passes and the food finally arrives. but wait! where is the baby's food? The waitress forgot the put the order in for my daughters food.  My happy 2 year old is now cranky and hungry and wants HER OWN burger and not mine. while we wait for the babes burger lets examine ours. mine, a chicken burger, was not crispy at all  but was in fact just a grilled piece of chicken.  the meat was too small for the bun in a way that just disappointing the sauce overpowering and dripped everywhere. my father in laws burger was the same the meat a bit cold and so much sauce that his bun disintegrated as he ate.  after about 20 minutes they bring out a tray of chicken fingers. i kindly let the waitress know i ordered a burger for the babe.   she takes it back and another 15 minutes later a "cheese" burger finally arrives for my daughter who is now way too fussy to eat. the burger is just a sad slab of thin meat on a cold dry bun, no condiments, no cheese nothing.   our bill came out  and at 50 bucks we just felt like we were robbed. i don't think i will ever return....ever.
